title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Ocean simulation game reveals how seals navigate underwater
items.description: Unusual setup shows how the animals get their bearings in deep ocean

items.title: To boost nuclear power, Trump orders controversial rewrite of radiation safety rules
items.description: Researchers have long debated the risks posed by low levels of ionizing radiation

items.title: Will NSF’s flagship training program survive under Trump?
items.description: Despite 50 Nobelists and 75,000 alumni, NSF’s graduate research fellows could be a vanishing breed

items.title: Leprosy was an American scourge long before Europeans arrived
items.description: Scientists find DNA from an enigmatic bacterium in 1000-year-old skeletons

items.title: Can gene-edited pigs solve the organ transplant shortage?
items.description: With clinical trials imminent, hopes are rising high for the long-struggling field of xenotransplantation

items.title: Philanthropist gives $90 million to support theoretical physics research
items.description: Leinweber Foundation donation will help fund postdocs and graduate students at multiple institutions

items.title: China is quietly preparing to build a gigantic telescope
items.description: Astronomers are puzzled by the silence over an instrument that could briefly reign as world’s biggest

items.title: U.S. aid helped two African countries rein in HIV. Then came Trump
items.description: In Lesotho and Eswatini, treatment and prevention cutbacks are hitting pregnant women, children, and teens especially hard

items.title: Watch a robot play badminton against human players
items.description: Advanced training lets a four-legged robot learn to move around the court with ease

items.title: Explorers of Ukrainian caves may have brought deadly bat fungus to U.S.
items.description: Study traces mysterious strain of white-nose disease to visits between American and European cavers
